Title: Register new user account (valid)
Preconditions: User is on https://demowebshop.tricentis.com and not logged in
Test Data: Email: unique (e.g., qa.user+<timestamp>@example.com); Password: P@ssw0rd!23; First/Last name: Test/User
Steps:
1) Click 'Register' in the header.
2) Select Gender (optional).
3) Enter First name and Last name.
4) Enter unique Email.
5) Enter Password and Confirm password.
6) Click 'Register'.
Expected Result:
1) Registration succeeds.
2) Success message is shown (e.g., 'Your registration completed').
3) Header shows 'Log out' and account email.
4) No validation errors are displayed.
Postconditions/Notes: Use a timestamped email to avoid conflicts. Verify password policy if any validation appears.

Title: Login with valid credentials + logout
Preconditions: A user account already exists (can be created via DWS-TC-001). User is on the site home page.
Test Data: Email: existing user; Password: matching password
Steps:
1) Click 'Log in'.
2) Enter Email and Password.
3) Click 'Log in'.
4) Verify user is logged in.
5) Click 'Log out'.
Expected Result:
1) Login succeeds and user is redirected to home (or previous page).
2) Header shows 'Log out' and account link.
3) After logout, header shows 'Log in' and 'Register'.
4) No protected pages remain accessible as logged-in without re-auth.
Postconditions/Notes: If 'Remember me' exists, test it separately.

Title: Search product and add to cart (quantity update + subtotal math)
Preconditions: User is on the home page; cart is empty or note existing cart items.
Test Data:
Product A: 'Build your own cheap computer' (qty=2)
Product B: 'Blue Jeans' (qty=1)
Steps:
1) Use the search box to search Product A.
2) Open Product A from results.
3) Click 'Add to cart' and verify notification.
4) Search Product B.
5) Open Product B and add to cart.
6) Open 'Shopping cart'.
7) Update quantities: A=2, B=1.
8) Click 'Update shopping cart'.
9) Capture Unit Price and Subtotal for each line.
10) Capture Cart Sub-Total (summary).
Expected Result:
1) Both products appear in cart.
2) Quantity updates persist after update.
3) For each line: Subtotal = Unit Price Ã— Quantity.
4) Cart Sub-Total = sum of all line subtotals.
5) No unexpected price changes after update.
Postconditions/Notes: This mirrors the key calculation checks used in the automation.

Title: Guest checkout end-to-end (shipping/payment + confirm order)
Preconditions: Cart has at least 2 items (can reuse DWS-TC-003). User is not logged in. Terms-of-service checkbox is visible.
Test Data:
Billing address:
First/Last: Test User
Email: unique
Country: United States
State: Alabama (if required)
City: Birmingham
Address1: 123 Test Street
ZIP: 35203
Phone: 5551234567
Shipping method: Ground
Payment method: Cash On Delivery
Steps:
1) From Shopping cart, tick 'I agree with the terms of service'.
2) Click 'Checkout'.
3) If prompted, choose 'Checkout as Guest'.
4) Fill Billing Address fields and Continue.
5) If 'Ship to the same address' option exists, keep enabled and Continue.
6) Select Shipping method 'Ground' and Continue.
7) Select Payment method 'Cash On Delivery' and Continue.
8) On payment information, click Continue.
9) On Confirm Order page, verify totals (Subtotal/Shipping/Tax/Total) are present.
10) Click 'Confirm'.
Expected Result:
1) Checkout steps complete without errors.
2) Order confirmation message appears (e.g., 'Your order has been successfully processed!').
3) Order is created and user can continue shopping.
4) Totals are consistent (Total = Subtotal + Shipping + Tax, where displayed).
Postconditions/Notes: If any step is skipped/auto-filled due to existing session, note it and re-run in a fresh session.

Title: Apply and remove discount/gift card code (negative + recovery)
Preconditions: User has at least 1 item in cart; user is on Shopping cart page.
Test Data: Coupon code: INVALIDCODE123 (or any obviously invalid code)
Steps:
1) In Shopping cart, locate the discount code / coupon box.
2) Enter invalid coupon code.
3) Click 'Apply coupon' (or equivalent).
4) Observe message and totals.
5) Clear the coupon code input.
6) Proceed to checkout is still possible (terms accepted) to ensure cart is not blocked.
Expected Result:
1) A clear error message is shown for invalid code.
2) No discount is applied.
3) Cart totals remain unchanged.
4) User can continue shopping/checkout normally after the error.
Postconditions/Notes: If the site uses 'gift card' instead of coupon, adapt steps to that input; goal is validation + non-blocking behavior.
